intro: Gyrostemon reticulatus, commonly known as the net-veined gyrostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, reticulate venation on its leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Gyrostemon reticulatus is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions.
